title: Notes of foreign travel.
author: Bates, James Hale
snippet: Frazer met us at the lodge-gate, and we drove to Dalkeith House, the seat of the Duke of Buccleuch and Queensbury, passing through the little village of Lasswade, where Scott passed some happy years of his early life, as he has written. Melville Castle, the seat of Viscount Melville, is near by. Dalkeith House stands in a large park with noble trees, singly and in clumps, over a far-spreading and luxuriant greensward.
